intro: Paepalanthus bosseri, commonly known as the yellow-flowered puya, is a member of the Bromeliaceae family and is native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a perennial herbaceous plant characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and striking yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes, often in humid, shaded environments. Its inflorescence consists of a single, terminal flower that is often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Paepalanthus bosseri is noted for its ornamental value and is cultivated in botanical gardens for its unique appearance.
